title: Boohoo hopes for boost from Cara Delevingne's new line for Nasty Gal
text:
Nasty Gal has launched a collection with Cara Delevingne this week.

And retail experts hoped the supermodel's 44million Instagram followers will give the label – which is part of online fashion retailer Boohoo's empire – a major boost.

But the collection is already being sold at a half-price discount.

On trend: Nasty Gal – which is part of online fashion retailer Boohoo's empire – has launched a collection with model Cara Delevingne (pictured) this week

The reduction comes only a few days after 27-year-old Delevingne attended the launch.

The 40-piece collection includes sequined dresses, tiger-print miniskirts, trouser suits and crop tops under the tagline 'always rebellious and ever-evolving'.

The gold Wild Zebra Skirt, however, has been discounted from £40 to £20, while the Big Love Velvet Dress has been cut from £60 to £30.

Boohoo said Nasty Gal was running a site-wide discount of 50 per cent, which therefore included Delevingne's line.

Experts predict Boohoo will book £500million of sales this year, with Nasty Gal contributing close to £100million.

City analysts at Jefferies said: With such high-profile campaigns, Nasty Gal is emerging as a strong third brand in Boohoo's stable.'
description: And retail experts hoped the supermodel's 44million Instagram followers will give the label - which is part of online fashion retailer Boohoo's empire - a major boost.
authors: Finance Reporter For The Daily Mail
